results.title: Mallee blossom
results.brief_description: This is Maureen Barry’s story of her life as a farmer, wife, mother and rural nurse in the dusty bowl of the Mallee in outback Victoria. She tells of the hardships and isolation, but also of the gradual blossoming of the land as both she and her husband keep pace with technology, embracing sustainable farming practices so as to leave the land in a better state for those who follow. This story is part of a project funded by VicHealth and partnership with the women’s rural network, Partners in Grain.

results.title: Building
results.creator_credit: Dale Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dale Smith dedicates her story to her dad, a man of infinite creativity and resourcefulness. His inventiveness extended to building houses, caravans, mobile homes, trailers and, above all, a family who adore him.

results.title: Swimming pool
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Foz, Gimages Films, France2 Cinema and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: In his first film in English, writer/director Francois Ozon directs two actors that have worked with him before - Charlotte Rampling (“Under The Sand”) and Ludivine Sagnier (“8 Women”). Enlisting performances that essentially carry the narrative, Ozon’s preference for films dealing with psychological manipulation is evident with this film. Sarah Morton (Rampling) is an English crime writer who jaded by her monetary success and fame seeks out her publisher John Bosload (Charles Dance) and a morning whiskey to help cheer her up. He suggests she uses his holiday house in France for a break and possibly some inspiration for her next novel in a detective series she has been writing. Her time in France seems to be just what she needs, until a visit by Bosload’s estranged daughter Julie (Sagnier) throws her staid and orderly self into disarray. Sexually provocative and physically beautiful, Julie becomes her new fascination and the two women form a bond when murder and muse become intertwined in their summer idyll by the swimming pool. Charlotte Rampling was winner of Best Actress from the European Film Academy in 2003 for her role of Morton. Official selection Cannes 2003. Cast includes Marc Fayolle and Jean-Marie Lamour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Foz, Gimages Films, France2 Cinema and Fidelite Productions

holdings.name: DVD; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: Encouragement and growth
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Education was always a focus in Nickie Berrisford’s life. In this story Nickie tells of her upbringing, her marriage to a Horsham farmer, rural life and her four children. She openly speaks of her role as an educator, wife, and mother, and of her fourth child Laura who was born with Down Syndrome. Nickie has also been a mentor - encouraging, challenging and supporting the other women in the grain industry. This is her tribute to family, friends and bonds that have been formed, hopefully never to be broken.
